net.sourceforge.gjtapi.media
Class FreeMediaTerminalConnection

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--net.sourceforge.gjtapi.FreeTerminalConnection
        |
        +--net.sourceforge.gjtapi.media.FreeMediaTerminalConnection
public class FreeMediaTerminalConnection
extends FreeTerminalConnection
implements javax.telephony.media.MediaTerminalConnection

The JTAPI 1.2 Media TerminalConnection.

Not yet fully implemented. This should only be created by FreeConnection.getLazyTerminalConnection() Creation date: (2000-04-26 14:28:12)

FreeMediaTerminalConnection

public FreeMediaTerminalConnection(javax.telephony.Connection con,
                                   java.lang.String termName)
Creates an instance of the deprecated JTAPI 1.2 MediaTerminalConnection between a Connection and a MediaTerminal.
Parameters:
con - The call connection to hook the TerminalConnection up to.
term - The name of a media terminal to hook the TerminalConnection to.

generateDtmf

public void generateDtmf(java.lang.String digits)
                  throws javax.telephony.InvalidStateException,
                         javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException
Forward a String of digits off to a DTMF signal generator.
Specified by:
generateDtmf in interface javax.telephony.media.MediaTerminalConnection
Parameters:
digits - The DTMF digits to play on the TerminalConnection
Throws:
javax.telephony.InvalidStateException - If the TerminalConnection is not ACTIVE
javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException - If the raw provider threw an exception.

getMediaAvailability

public int getMediaAvailability()
Returns the current media availability state, either AVAILABLE or UNAVAILABLE. Any TerminalConnection in state ACTIVE is considered AVAILABLE.

Specified by:
getMediaAvailability in interface javax.telephony.media.MediaTerminalConnection
Returns:
The current availability of the media channel.

getMediaState

public int getMediaState()
Returns a bitwise OR of the PLAYING and RECODING bits. Otherwise NOACTIVITY.

Specified by:
getMediaState in interface javax.telephony.media.MediaTerminalConnection
Returns:
The current state of playing or recording.

                  throws javax.telephony.InvalidStateException,
                         javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException
Start playing a URL set in the "usePlayURL()" method.
Specified by:
startPlaying in interface javax.telephony.media.MediaTerminalConnection
Tags copied from interface: javax.telephony.media.MediaTerminalConnection
Throws:
javax.telephony.MethodNotSupportedException - The implementation does not support playing to the telephone line.
javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException - Indicates playing is not able to be started because some resource is unavailable.
javax.telephony.InvalidStateException - Indicates the TerminalConnection is not in the media channel available state.

useDefaultMicrophone

public void useDefaultMicrophone()
Try to set the microphone as the player source. We code this as "".
Specified by:
useDefaultMicrophone in interface javax.telephony.media.MediaTerminalConnection
Tags copied from interface: javax.telephony.media.MediaTerminalConnection
Throws:
javax.telephony.PrivilegeViolationException - Indicates the application is not permitted to direct voice media from the default microphone.
javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException - Indicates that the microphone is not currently available for use.
javax.telephony.MethodNotSupportedException - This method is not supported by the implementation.

useDefaultSpeaker

public void useDefaultSpeaker()
Try to set the Speaker as the output to the record command. We code this as "".
Specified by:
useDefaultSpeaker in interface javax.telephony.media.MediaTerminalConnection
Tags copied from interface: javax.telephony.media.MediaTerminalConnection
Throws:
javax.telephony.PrivilegeViolationException - Indicates the application is not permitted to direct voice media to the default speaker.
javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException - Indicates that the speaker is not currently available for use.
javax.telephony.MethodNotSupportedException - This method is not supported by the implementation.

usePlayURL

public void usePlayURL(java.net.URL url)
Set the URL that defines which resource to play.
Specified by:
usePlayURL in interface javax.telephony.media.MediaTerminalConnection
Tags copied from interface: javax.telephony.media.MediaTerminalConnection
Parameters:
url - The URL-source of the voice data to play. valid or available source of voice data.
Throws:
javax.telephony.PrivilegeViolationException - Indicates the application is not permitted to use the give URL for playing.
javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException - Indicates the URL given is not available, either because the URL was invalid or a network problem occurred.
javax.telephony.MethodNotSupportedException - This method is not supported by the implementation.

useRecordURL

public void useRecordURL(java.net.URL url)
Set the URL that defines where to record to.
Specified by:
useRecordURL in interface javax.telephony.media.MediaTerminalConnection
Tags copied from interface: javax.telephony.media.MediaTerminalConnection
Parameters:
url - The URL-destination for the voice data for recording.
Throws:
javax.telephony.PrivilegeViolationException - Indicates the application is not permitted to use the give URL for recording.
javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException - Indicates the URL given is not available, either because the URL was invalid or a network problem occurred.
javax.telephony.MethodNotSupportedException - This method is not supported by the implementation.
